com.nicta.scoobij
Interface DList<A>

All Known Subinterfaces:
DGroupedTable<K,V>, DTable<K,V>
All Known Implementing Classes:
DGroupedTableImpl, DListImpl, DTableImpl
public interface DList<A>

A distributed collection of object. The central abstraction of HDFS

Method Summary

Method Detail

parallelDo

<B> DList<B> parallelDo(DoFn<A,B> fun,
                        WireFormatType<B> wf)
Apply a specified function to "chunks" of elements from the distributed list to produce zero or more output elements. The resulting output elements from the many "chunks" form a new distributed list.

Parameters:
fun - the function to execute
wf - the runtime type info object
Returns:
a new DList that representats the results after a parallelDo

flatMap

<B> DList<B> flatMap(FlatMapper<A,B> fm,
                     WireFormatType<B> wf)
For each element of the distributed list produce zero or more elements by applying a specified function. The resulting collection of elements form a new distributed list.

Parameters:
fm - the function that is used to flatmap from A to B
wf - the typeinfo for B
Returns:
a new DList the is result of the flatmap

tableFlatMap

<B,C> DTable<B,C> tableFlatMap(TableFlatMapper<A,B,C> tm,
                               WireFormatType<B> wfB,
                               WireFormatType<C> wfC)
A version of flatMap, except for when the result should be a DTable instead of a DList. For each element of the distributed list produce zero or more Key Value elements by applying a specified function. The resulting collection of elements form a new distributed list.

concat

DList<A> concat(DList<A>... dLists)
Concatenate one or more distributed lists to form a new distributed list. Is ++ from scoobi.DList

Parameters:
dLists - are all concatenated together
Returns:
a new DList that is the concatenated product

map

<B> DList<B> map(Mapper<A,B> map,
                 WireFormatType<B> wf)
For each element of the distributed list produce a new element by applying a specified function. The resulting collection of elements form a new distributed list.

tableMap

<B,C> DTable<B,C> tableMap(TableMapper<A,B,C> tm,
                           WireFormatType<B> wfB,
                           WireFormatType<C> wfC)
The same as a map, except for when the result should be a DTable, not a DList

filter

DList<A> filter(Filterer<A> filter,
                WireFormatType<A> wf)
Keep elements from the distributedl list that pass a spcecified predicate function.

filterNot

DList<A> filterNot(Filterer<A> filter,
                   WireFormatType<A> wf)
Keep elements from the distributedl list that do not pass a spcecified predicate function.

groupBy

<K> DGroupedTable<K,A> groupBy(Mapper<A,K> mapper,
                               OrderedWireFormatType<K> wfK,
                               WireFormatType<A> wfA)
Group the values of a distributed list according to some discriminator function.

by

<K> DTable<K,A> by(Mapper<A,K> mapper,
                   WireFormatType<K> wfK,
                   WireFormatType<A> wfA)
Create a new distributed list that is keyed based on a specified function.

getImpl

 getImpl()
Returns the underlying scala implementation object. Hopefully not required for end users.
